intro: Oplismenus hirtellus subsp. tsushimensis, commonly known as the Japanese nettle or Japanese horsewhin, is a flowering plant native to East Asia. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes many stinging plants. The subspecies is characterized by its finely toothed leaves and small, greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. Its foliage is often used in traditional herbal medicine for its purported health benefits.
